quizzes.question: Which keyword is used to create shadow within the element?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Creating an Inner Shadow[/h1]

The "[b]inset"[/b] keyword allows to draw an inner shadow in the box. To show an inset shadow, just add the inset keyword:[code format="css" codeId="586"]box-shadow: [b]inset [/b]10px 10px 5px #888888;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2672" width="100%"]
[note]You can simultaneously create [b]inner[/b] and [b]outer[/b] shadows by separating each shadow with a [b]comma[/b].[/note]

quizzes.question: Multiple box shadows are separated by ...
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Layering Multiple Shadows[/h1]

You can define as many shadows for the same box as you want by writing all of them [b]comma-separated[/b] in the same rule. 

In the example below, two [b]inner [/b]shadows have been created by separating each shadow with a [b]comma[/b]. [code format="css" codeId="587"]box-shadow: 
[b]inset[/b] 10px 10px 5px #888888[b], 
inset[/b] -10px -10px 5px #888888;[/code]
[b]Result: [/b] [img id="2673" width="100%"]
In case we specify more than one value, the one which comes last will be positioned at the back of all shadows. 
Here is an example:[code format="css" codeId="588"]box-shadow: 0 0 10px 4px #FF6347[b],[/b] 
0 0 10px 30px #FFDAB9[b],[/b] 
30px 0 20px 30px #B0E0E6;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2674" width="100%"]
[note]As expected, the blue shadow ([b]#B0E0E6[/b]) comes last.[/note]
